CCR1994

Ok folks, I caught some of Dr Phil's show on Friday and there was a woman on the show who's boyfriend was a cross dresser and it got me to thinking "why is it when a woman wears men's clothing, nobody thinks it is a big deal but let us find out a man wears women's clothing it's labeled cross dressing and suddenly it's freak out time?" Why the double standard? Why can't men feel comfortable in a skirt and high heels? I mean come on, who is being harmed by this. Let these men have their fun.

Ok folks, I caught some of Dr Phil's show on Friday and there was a woman on the show who's boyfriend was a cross dresser and it got me to thinking "why is it when a woman wears men's clothing, nobody thinks it is a big deal but let us find out a man wears women's clothing it's labeled cross dressing and suddenly it's freak out time?" Why the double standard? Why can't men feel comfortable in a skirt and high heels? I mean come on, who is being harmed by this. Let these men have their fun.

 
 Do women  feel comfortable in high heels?? It is a strange phenomenon, though.

Geesh! My mind ain't right, yet, boss!
 
 Let me see... sitting around deer camp, eating beans, onions....and next to me a man dressed in a pink dress...
 
 I gotta get my mind right... emoticon_frazzled

Big Orn

Ever seen a woman in a dress?! emoticon_wow

 I thawt I did oncet, but it was jess 'nother scarecrow got took up by a swuff wind... emoticon_ic ;) 
 
 FYI - I saw a picture of my dad (pushing 70 now) who was wearing a real thin, white, cotton dress and his friend who was wearing a tight (way-too-tight) evening gown, posing for a picture for his oil field buddies back in the '50's. Both had curlers in their hair. It wasn't that bad of a pic and he still has a laugh or two about it. I didn't think too much of that. But, I could not (I don't think) sit around deer camp with a man wearing one.
 JMHO, though. :)

99%BEEF

I think men don't wear high heals cause generally they are tall anyway. Mind you some men like Tom Cruise wear stacked soled shoes. The dress thing is just culture, the Scots have kilts and loads of men in the church wear robes which are really just dresses.
 
 The thing is in our culture everyone associates dresses with being feminine so if a man wants to wear a dress it's not because it's comfortable but because they find it sexually stimulating.

How about a woman in high heels, nice white dress and make up.... carrying the winchester across her lap, chewing down meet and chugging beer ? emoticon_xhoho

 That wouldn’t bother me as long as I knew her – maybe she’d gotten disgusted with her husband/boyfriend and just didn’t give a whiz about changing to “formal” clothing before going to camp.
 
 But, Bubba doing it would be another issue. I would let him chew his cud for awhile, take a drink, watch his impressions and then bounce him out about it. Maybe ask, “Bad day at work?”….. :)
